name: Blockchain Fundamentals
description: In this module we'll cover the fundamentals of public, permissionless blockchains like Bitcoin and Ethereum, it's benefits and how they can be used. This module is an excellent beginner quiz to test your knowledge.

questions.title: What is a blockchain?
answers: A replacement for traditional databases
A regulatory framework for a new financial infrastructure
A platform to find and collect digital art
A distributed ledger with growing lists of records (blocks) that are securely linked together via cryptographic hashes
All of the above
None of the above

questions.title: What is the primary function of a public blockchain (like Bitcoin or Ethereum)?
answers: To process transactions
To store data
To send private and anonynomous payments
To run applications
All of the above
None of the above

questions.title: What makes a blockchain decentralized?
answers: The ledger is stored on a secure server
Account balances and transactions are anonymous and hidden
The ledger is accessible by a large, distributed network of indepedent computers
Cheap and instant transactions
All of the above
None of the above

questions.title: Which of the following is NOT a type of consensus algorithm?
answers: Proof of Work (PoW)
Proof of Authority (PoA)
Proof of Attendance Protocol (POAP)
Proof of Stake (PoS)

questions.title: How would you describe the Byzantine General's Problem?
answers: A way to store and distribute data in a decentralized, permissionless network
A way to reach consensus in a decentralized, permissionless network
A way to connect with more than 51% of the network
A reference to the Art of War (by Sun Tzu) that can be applied to modern computer infrastructure

questions.title: What is the function of a node (sometimes also called 'miner' or 'validator')?
answers: They are required to run in order for you to receive payments on the network
They provide a service to the network by downloading and verifying transactions sent to the network
They generate revenue for the network
They connect all the participants of the network with each other
All of the above
None of the above

questions.title: What is a smart contract?
answers: A legal agreement between 2 parties
A type of cryptocurrency
A piece of self-executing code that runs on a blockchain
A protocol used for secure communication

questions.title: What is a crypto wallet?
answers: An account that protects my digital assets
A device with RFID technology
An app that proves my identity to the blockchain
An app that is connected to the blockchain to be able to accept transaction

questions.title: What is the purpose of a block hash?
answers: To encrypt the data of a block to keep its content private and secure
To provide a unique identifier for each block
To cryptographically link each block to the previous so it can't be tampered with
To ensure the transactions are sent to the correct recipients

questions.title: What is the definition of a transaction?
answers: A secret exchange of messages between a selected group of peers
An atomic event that is broadcasted by the underlying protocol
The transmission of a message between nodes to update the state of the network
The impact on an account's balance

questions.title: Who's the inventor of the Bitcoin protocol?
answers: Satoshi Nakamoto
Vitalik Buterin
Hal Finney
Alan Turing

questions.title: Who first coined the term 'Web3'
answers: Satoshi Nakamoto
Vitalik Buterin
Jack Dorsey
Gavin Wood
